channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Names His Picks for Top Pentagon Roles
item.description: They include a billionaire investor who supported Mr. Trump’s campaign, a former official who froze aid to Ukraine and a former executive at Uber.

item.title: Christmas Market Attack in Germany Stirs Political Sniping
item.description: After an assailant driving an S.U.V. killed five people, calls for solidarity have quickly given way to criticism by rival lawmakers, ahead of snap el...

item.title: Christmas Market Attack in Germany Stirs Political Sniping
item.description: After an assailant driving an S.U.V. killed five people, calls for solidarity have quickly given way to criticism by rival lawmakers, ahead of snap el...

item.title: Woman Dies After Being Set on Fire in Subway Car, Police Say
item.description: The police said a man was taken into custody. The victim had been seated in a subway car at the Coney Island-Stillwell Avenue station on Sunday mornin...

item.title: Musk urges Bezos to throw an ‘epic wedding’ after Amazon founder blasts report of $600 million nuptials as ‘completely false’
item.description: Bezos flatly denied a report he would marry fiancée Lauren Sánchez the weekend after Christmas in a lavish ceremony in Aspen.

item.title: Surging cases and lagging vaccines: Why this U.S. flu season has experts worried
item.description: Thirteen states reported high or very high levels of flu-like illness last week, about double from the week before.

item.title: Mpox Is Spreading in Congo’s Capital, Threatening Global Efforts to Contain the Virus
item.description: In crowded Kinshasa, two strains of mpox are sweeping through a community that relies on selling sex. Hundreds of thousands of vaccines sent to the co...

item.title: Mozambique Court Upholds Result in Disputed Presidential Election
item.description: The ruling comes after protests that left more than 100 people dead, and paves the way for the candidate from the long-governing Frelimo party to take...

item.title: Half of companies with office space say leases are affecting their RTO policies
item.description: Companies say they want to increase worker collaboration productivity, but many leaders are also influenced by existing office leases.

item.title: Under Pressure, Telegram Turns a Profit for the First Time
item.description: Even as Telegram faces legal scrutiny and grapples with billions in debt, it is set to be profitable for the first time as it tries cryptocurrencies, ...

item.title: Luigi Mangione Pleads Not Guilty to N.Y. Charges in UnitedHealthcare CEO Killing
item.description: The Manhattan district attorney’s office has charged Luigi Mangione, who is accused of killing UnitedHealthcare’s chief executive, with first-degree m...

item.title: The alleged online smear campaign against Blake Lively is a reminder of how eager society is to ‘hate on women’
item.description: The "It Ends With Us" actress was likely the victim of an online smear campaign.

item.title: Trump’s demand for control of Greenland is immediately rejected
item.description: Greenland’s PM: “Greenland is ours. We are not for sale and will never be for sale.”

item.title: Alfa Anderson, Singer With Chic, Dies at 78
item.description: She sang the famous refrain “Le freak, c’est chic,” on one of disco’s biggest hits and was a sought-after vocalist for many prominent artists.

item.title: A Canceled Vote in Romania Hands Russia a Propaganda Coup
